com.ibm.jaggr.service

Interface IRequestListener


  • public interface IRequestListener
    Listener interface for HTTP request processing. The start method is called for all registered listeners by the aggregator at the start of request processing.

    Listeners are registered as an OSGi service using the name of the aggregator as the name attribute of the listener object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void endRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Called when processing of a request completes normally.
      void startRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Called by the aggregator at the start of request processing.

    • Method Detail

      • startRequest

        void startRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Called by the aggregator at the start of request processing. The transport has already set the request attributes defined in IHttpTransport.

        This method is called by the main request processing thread, so the request object can be updated without worrying about threading issues.

        Parameters:
        request - the request object
        response - the response object

      • endRequest

        void endRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Called when processing of a request completes normally. All worker threads that have been started for module builders on this request have finished and the response is ready to be returned to the client.

        This method is not guaranteed to be called following a call to startRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse) if, for example, an exception is thrown while processing the request.

        Parameters:
        request - the request object
        response - the response object
